title: Authors and Citation
text: Liu Z (2024). Linkage: Package (Title Case). R package version 2.1.0, https://aicplane.github.io/Linkage/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Linkage: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Zenghui Liu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.1.0},   url = {https://aicplane.github.io/Linkage/}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Linkage user-friendly, interactive, open-source R-Shiny web application  exploring visualizing potential gene regulatory elements based  ATAC-seq  RNA-seq data. Users can upload customized data obtain genome-wide gene regulatory elements simple clicks. gene regulatory elements predicted multi-omics data, rather experimentally determined. Users can easily search, browse, download peak-gene scatter plot given gene. continue update Linkage add modules downstream analysis future. ```{r} (!requireNamespace(“devtools”, quietly = TRUE)) install.packages(“devtools”) devtools::install_github(“aicplane/Linkage”) Shiny application additionally hosted https://xulabgdpu.org.cn/linkage
code: ```{r} library(Linkage) Install.biocViews() Linkage()

title: Enrichment analysis Barplot — barplot
code: extdatadir <- system.file(paste0("extdata"), package = "Linkage") gene_list <- read.table(paste0(extdatadir,"/Senescence-associated secretory phenotype.txt")) go <- GO.enrichment(gene_list = gene_list$V1, Species = "Homo", genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name") #> Warning: cannot open file 'inst/extdata/homo.gene_positions.plus.txt': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection barplot(go) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'go' not found

title: Regulate peak genomic location browsing boxplot — box_plot
Regulate peak genomic location browsing boxplot — box_plot
code: extdatadir <- system.file(paste0("extdata"), package = "Linkage") peakfile <- read.csv(paste0(extdatadir,"/ENSG00000000419.csv"), header = T, check.names = F) gene <- data.table::fread(paste0(extdatadir,"/TCGA-BRCA-RNA.txt"), header = T) gene <- gene[gene$ensembl_gene_id == "ENSG00000000419", ] p <- trackplot(peakfile = peakfile, 1, "Homo")  box_plot(peakfile, gene, select_peak = 1, F) #> Error in subset(gene, select = colnames(gene) %in% rownames(v1)) %>% t() %>%     data.frame(group = "group1"): could not find function "%>%"

To cite Bioconductor, see #>     'citation("Biobase")', and for packages 'citation("pkgname")'. #> Loading required package: IRanges #> Warning: package 'IRanges' was built under R version 4.3.1 #> Loading required package: S4Vectors #> Warning: package 'S4Vectors' was built under R version 4.3.1 #>  #> Attaching package: 'S4Vectors' #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     findMatches #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     I, expand.grid, unname #>  #> Attaching package: 'IRanges' #> The following object is masked from 'package:grDevices': #>  #>     windows #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> >> assigning chromosome lengths			 2024-02-05 19:48:29  #> >> done...					 2024-02-05 19:48:29

what: Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
title: Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
code: regulatory_peak(RNA.seq, ATAC.seq, range, cor_method)

title: Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
text: RNA.seq Expression single multiple genes ATAC.seq ATAC-Seq Expression Matrix range Expand range genes find regulatory peaks cor_method correlation calculation, pearson/spearman/kendall can selected

title: Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
Finding the regulatory peak of genes — regulatory_peak
code: extdatadir <- system.file(paste0("extdata"), package = "Linkage") RNA.seq <- data.table::fread(paste0(extdatadir,"/TCGA-BRCA-RNA.txt"), header = T)[c(1:10), ] position <- data.table::fread(paste0(extdatadir,"/homo.gene_positions.plus.txt"), header = T, sep = "\t") RNA.seq <- merge(position, RNA.seq, by.x = "ensembl_gene_id", by.y = "ensembl_gene_id") Homo.list.files <- list.files(paste0(extdatadir,"/Homo.ATAC/")) Homo.list.files <- paste0(paste0(extdatadir,"/Homo.ATAC/"),Homo.list.files) Homo.df_list <- lapply(Homo.list.files,function(file) data.table::fread(file,header = T)) ATAC.seq <- do.call(rbind, Homo.df_list) regulatory_peak(RNA.seq, ATAC.seq, 500000, "spearman") #> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(x, name, value): replacement has 0 rows, data has 32
